comments:
This course shows how the method of separation of variables is applied to solve the wave, heat, and Laplace equations. In addition, one or more of the following topics is covered: qualitative properties of solutions of various equations (characteristics, maximum principles, uniqueness theorems), Laplace and Fourier transform methods, and approximation techniques.

Students thoroughly enjoyed the course material, saying the material was “useful” for math and science majors.

Students heaped praise upon Professor Kazdan, calling Professor Kazdan a “fantastic lecturer.” Furthermore, students found that Professor Kazdan went “above and beyond the call of duty in trying to help students understand the subject matter” and was able to “inspire interest in the material.”

The course included weekly homework problems and exams, which students found to be “quite fair and reasonable.” This course has a prerequisite requirement of MATH241, and knowledge of PHYS150-151 is helpful.
